snippet: Two different stories have emerged about how Jacob Ostreicher, who was jailed in Bolivia, managed to make his way to the United States.
lead_paragraph: Two different stories have emerged about how Jacob Ostreicher, who was jailed in Bolivia, managed to make his way to the United States.
abstract: Two discrete stories emerge about how Jacob Ostreicher, Brooklyn businessman who was jailed in Santa Cruz, Bolivia, for 18 months in 2011, then placed under house arrest, escaped back to the United States; Bolivian Justice Min Cecilia Ayllon says Ostreicher, who was accused of money laundering, slipped from house arrest clandestinely, while his daughter says she was told he was freed after ransom was paid.

headline.main: Conflicting Tales on How a Brooklyn Businessman Evaded Bolivian Custody

byline.contributor: Joseph Berger reported from New York, and William Neuman from La Paz, Bolivia. Monica Machicao contributed reporting from La Paz, and Andrea Zarate from Lima, Peru.
byline.original: By JOSEPH BERGER and WILLIAM NEUMAN
